precondition: The Windows XP desktop is visible.
action: Click the 'Start' button located in the bottom left corner of the screen.
expected_results: The Start Menu will open, displaying a list of program shortcuts and system options.

precondition: The Windows XP 'Start' menu is open and the mouse cursor is hovering over the 'Control Panel' option.
action: Click the 'Control Panel' option in the Start menu.
expected_results: The Start menu will close and the Control Panel window will open.

precondition: The Windows XP Control Panel is open and in Category view.
expected_results: The Control Panel will transition to display the icons and options within the "Appearance and Themes" category.

precondition: The "Appearance and Themes" window is open in the Windows XP Control Panel. The "Display" icon is visible in the "or pick a Control Panel icon" section.
expected_results: The "Display Properties" window will open, covering the "Appearance and Themes" window. The "Display Properties" window will show several tabs, including "Themes," "Desktop," "Screen Saver," "Appearance," and "Settings".

precondition: The "Screen Saver" tab within the "Display Properties" window is open.
action: Click the "Screen saver" dropdown menu and select "[None]".
expected_results: The "Screen saver" dropdown menu will display "[None]" and the "Wait" time controls will become disabled.

precondition: The 'Screen Saver' tab of the 'Display Properties' window is open. The 'Power' button is visible at the bottom of the window.
expected_results: The 'Power Options Properties' window will open. The window displays the active power scheme and the current monitor turn-off setting.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open, and the "Home/Office Desk" power scheme is selected.
action: Click on the dropdown menu next to one of the power management options (e.g., "Turn off monitor", "Turn off hard disks", "System standby", or "System hibernates").
expected_results: The clicked dropdown menu will expand, displaying a list of selectable time intervals.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the "Home/Office Desk" power scheme is selected.
action: Click on the "Power schemes" dropdown menu and select "Always On".
expected_results: The "Power schemes" dropdown menu will display "Always On" as the selected power scheme. The power-saving options for "Turn off monitor", "Turn off hard disks", "System standby", and "System hibernates" will all be set to "Never".

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open.
action: Click the "Power schemes" dropdown menu and select "Always On".
expected_results: The "Power schemes" dropdown menu will show "Always On" as the selected power scheme.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the "Power schemes" dropdown menu is visible.
action: Click on the "Always On" option in the "Power schemes" dropdown menu.
expected_results: The "Always On" power scheme will be selected.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the "Always On" power scheme is selected.
action: Click the "Turn off monitor" dropdown menu.
expected_results: A list of time intervals will appear, allowing you to select how long the computer should wait before turning off the monitor.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the "Apply" button is highlighted.
expected_results: The "Power Options Properties" window will close. The "Turn off hard disks", "System standby", and "System hibernates" dropdown menus will display "Never".

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the "Power Schemes" tab is selected. The "System hibernates" dropdown menu is open.
action: Click the "Never" option in the "System hibernates" dropdown menu.
expected_results: The "System hibernates" dropdown menu will close and display "Never". The dropdown menus for "Turn off monitor", "Turn off hard disks", and "System standby" should also display "Never".

precondition: The "Display Properties" window is open and the "Screen Saver" tab is selected.
action: Click anywhere on the background of the "Display Properties" window.
expected_results: The mouse cursor will move away from the "OK" button.

precondition: The "Appearance and Themes" window is open in the Windows Control Panel.
action: Click on the "Display" icon under the "or pick a Control Panel icon" section.
